raw_text:
Career honour for actor DiCaprio
 
 Actor Leonardo DiCaprio's "exceptional career" has been honoured at the Santa Barbara International Film Festival.
 
 The star was presented with the award by Martin Scorsese, who directed him in Oscar-nominated movie The Aviator. "It's a lifetime achievement award, which is completely and utterly surreal, given I'm only 30 years old," DiCaprio said. "But what has it been? Almost 17 years now. I've done quite a few films." A retrospective of his movies was shown.
 
 "What's really exciting, for me, is that this is what I really love doing," he added. "It's what I want to do for the rest of my life." DiCaprio began his movie career in horror film Critters 3, before moving onto roles in The Basketball Diaries, Romeo and Juliet, Titanic and Gangs of New York. The achievement award was created to commemorate the California festival's 20th anniversary and coincided with DiCaprio's portrayal of millionaire Howard Hughes in The Aviator.
 
 Veteran actress Jane Russell, who starred in Hughes' 1943 film The Outlaw, said was impressed by DiCaprio's quest for authenticity when he previously discussed the role with her. "I was very happy that (DiCaprio) came and cared to come up and find out what (Hughes) was really like," she said. The Aviator has taken pole position in this year's Oscars race with 11 nominations, including nominations for best film, best actor for DiCaprio and best director for Scorsese.

DiCaprio discussed how he continues to pursue his passion for acting despite being 30 years old, mentioning his extensive filmography including "Titanic", "Gangs of New York", and "The Aviator". The award was also seen as a nod to his role in the 1943 film "The Outlaw" starring veteran actress Jane Russell.

Career honour for actor DiCaprio

The retrospective showcased his 17-year career, starting with horror film "Critters 3" and including roles in "The Basketball Diaries," "Romeo and Juliet," "Titanic," and "Gangs of New York." DiCaprio cited his passion for acting as the reason behind his continued success. The award coincided with DiCaprio's portrayal of Howard Hughes, a character influenced by Jane Russell, who appeared in Hughes' 1943 film "The Outlaw." "The Aviator" received 11 Oscar nominations, including best actor for DiCaprio and best director for Scorsese.
opencoder:1.5b:
"Career honour for actor Leonardo DiCaprio's exceptional career has been honoured at the Santa Barbara International Film Festival." 

DiCaprio was a lifetime achievement award presented by Martin Scorsese. "It's an extraordinary film, which is completely and utterly surreal," he said. "However, it gives you an opportunity to showcase your passion for cinema and movies," DiCaprio said. His career has been filled with roles including in Critters 3, The Basketball Diaries, Romeo and Juliet, Titanic, and Gangs of New York.

DiCaprio's role at The Aviator was a remarkable one as he directed it in Oscar-nominated movie The Aviator. "It’s a lifetime achievement award, which is completely and utterly surreal," he said. "You see what happens when you’re just 30 years old? That’s a lifetime – almost 17 years now."

A retrospective of his films gave rise to DiCaprio's unique story, where he embarks on an extraordinary journey that would not be possible without him. His quest for authenticity has been marked by the role he played in The Outlaw.

Jane Russell, who starred in Hughes' film The Outlaw, expressed satisfaction with DiCaprio’s quest for authentic film representation when he discussed her with the veteran actor. "I am extremely happy that (DiCaprio) came to come up and find out what (Hughes) really enjoyed," she said. The Aviator has taken pole position in the Oscars race with 11 nominations, including three of these awards for best film, best actor DiCaprio, and director Scorsese.
smollm:1.7b:
The career of Leonardo DiCaprio is a remarkable one, marked by an impressive body of work that spans over three decades. From his early days in horror films to his later success as a leading man in Oscar-nominated movies, DiCaprio's career has been nothing short of exceptional. His dedication and passion for acting have earned him numerous awards and accolades throughout the years.

One of the most significant highlights of DiCaprio's career is the "Exceptional Career" award presented to him by Martin Scorsese at the Santa Barbara International Film Festival in 2019. This recognition was a testament to the impact he has had on the film industry, and it comes as no surprise given his impressive body of work over the years.

DiCaprio's "Exceptional Career" award is not just a tribute to his achievements but also a reflection of his dedication and perseverance in pursuing his passion for acting. He has been nominated for numerous awards throughout his career, including the Academy Award for Best Actor for his portrayal of Howard Hughes in The Aviator (2019). This nomination was particularly significant given that DiCaprio's performance as Hughes is widely regarded as one of the greatest Oscar-winning performances of all time.

The "Exceptional Career" award also coincided with DiCaprio's participation in the Santa Barbara International Film Festival, which celebrates the 20th anniversary of the festival. This recognition was a fitting tribute to the city that has played host to some of the most iconic films and filmmakers over the years.

DiCaprio's "Exceptional Career" award is also significant because it marks a milestone in his career, as he continues to push himself creatively and strive for excellence in every role he takes on. His dedication to his craft has earned him numerous accolades and recognition throughout the years, and this year's Oscars are no exception.

In conclusion, Leonardo DiCaprio's "Exceptional Career" award is a testament to his remarkable talent, dedication, and perseverance in pursuing his passion for acting. The achievement is not just a tribute to his achievements but also a reflection of his commitment to excellence and his impact on the film industry as a whole.
